common.addNewWalletOrImport: Add a new wallet or import one
common.emptyStateModalSubtitle: Recreate the multisig on more coordinators. Receive a small amount and send a part of it. Check the balances are appropriately reflected across all the coordinators after each step.
common.dontShowAgain: Don’t show me this message again
common.noElectrumServerText: You are not connected to any Electrum Server. Fetching your balances, receiving incoming transactions, and sending new transactions may not work. You can select a server to use in the Node Settings.
common.electrumServerConnectionFailedText: Failed to connect to Electrum server. Fetching your balances, receiving incoming transactions, and sending new transactions may not work. Check your network connection and try again.
common.disconnectingFromServerText: You are about to disconnect from the current Electrum server. Fetching your balances, receiving incoming transactions, and broadcasting new transactions will not be possible until you connect to another server.

noInternet.there: There seems to be a problem with your
noInternet.some: Some of the features will not work as expected in your Hexa app, including:

login.forgotPasscodeDesc: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur eiusmod tempor
login.CreateApp: Create a fresh app or recover an exisiting one
login.StoreBicoin: You can use these wallets to store small amounts of bitcoin for day to day transactions.
login.CreateMultiKeyWalletDesc: Setup multi-key wallets as per your needs and convenience for long term hodling. You would be able to choose your desired configuration of keys. Note that we call multi-key wallets as vault within Keeper.
login.RecoverAppDesc: Have an inaccessible Keeper app with various wallets and vaults in it? You have nothing to worry if you have that wallet’s 12-word Recovery Key. Just insert those words to recover that Keeper app and all your wallets would be restored as expected.
login.Wait: This step will take a few seconds. You would be able to proceed soon
login.Agreement: By proceeding you agree to our
login.Youcanreset: You can reset your Login Passcode if you have set up an Encryption Key (Strong Password, Own Passphrase or Security Answer). It seems you have not set up any
login.tos_agree: By proceeding to the next step, you agree to our
login.appcreates: The app creates a new wallet for you with accounts you can start using right away
login.previously: If you previously had Hexa, you can recover it using the Recovery Keys with these options
login.restoreNoteV1: If you are trying to migrate from Hexa 1.0 to Hexa 2.0, please read how in the link below
login.proceeding: By proceeding to the next step, you agree to our
login.numbers: Numbers or special characters are not supported
login.WalletCreationNumbers: Wallet Name must contain only alphabets
login.Youcanincrease: You can increase your security level from the Security Center. Level 2 + Savings Account provides you with greater security while Level 3 adds further resiliency
login.Selectanencryption: Select an encryption option that is right for you. It is recommended that you have a backup in place before you start using the wallet
login.info: Wallet name is used in the messages you send to your Friends & Family contacts
login.Thismay: This may take a short time, while the app sets it all up for you:
login.Hexaencrypts: Hexa encrypts and secures all the data on the app and any communication that goes out
login.preloading: Preloading the Test Account with test sats
login.Answersmust: Answers must only contain lowercase characters (a-z) and digits (0-9)
login.Passwordmust: Password must only contain lowercase characters (a-z) and digits (0-9)
login.Numbersorspecial: Numbers or special characters are not supported
login.Makesure: Make sure you remember the encryption password and keep it safe
login.ResetPassSubPara1: Your passcode has been reset successfully
login.ResetPassSubPara2: Your passcode can only be reset if you have your wallet backup safe and accessible
login.shareAnalyticsDesc: Only data relevant to app diagnostics is collected. You can optionally share email id while setting up inheritance.
login.shareAnalyticsSubTitle: If you so choose, you can allow Keeper to collect data that would help us serve you better.

home.Delarationdesc:
This letter is a declaration that I, Anant Tapadia, wish to leave behind the sum of 7.2 bitcoin to my son Gunther Greene.

I attest that I’m voluntarily choosing to bequeath this wealth to my son and am under no obligation or influence of any kind to do so.
home.Insertaseed: Insert a seed to import your existing wallet
home.ScanQRAddBackup: Scan the QR below to add Backup Key
home.Reviewtransaction: Review transaction details below before clicking Confirm
home.HexaPaywalletsecurity: You are about the enhance your Hexa Pay wallet's security
home.amountdesc: The QR code will change once an amount is entered
home.reflectSats: It would take some time for sats to reflect in your wallet based on fees paid by sender
home.Thiswillbesecured: This will be secured once it crosses 0.1 btc
home.RelayWalletErrorMessage: Something went wrong - Wallet creation failed

inheritence.Chooseyourbeneficiarycarefully: Make sure your legacy would be alive and glorious. Choose your beneficiary carefully.
inheritence.SecurityAndInheritanceDescp: Tools and tips to secure your bitcoin
inheritence.receivesyourbitcoininheritance: Select who receives your bitcoin inheritance
inheritence.hodledforlong: The one you hodled for so long
inheritence.Readbeforesigning: Read the text below before signing
inheritence.UpgradetoElitetier: Upgrade to Elite tier and setup the vault with 5 signers
inheritence.Downloadandsafelykeepinheritencedocument: Download and safely keep inheritence documents. Safekeeping best practices. Will template for digital assets. Inheritance recovery instructions
inheritence.tryingtorecoveryourwallet: If someone is trying to recover your wallet, make sure you get notified to approve or deny the recovery
inheritence.UnderstandhowyoucanrecoveryourVault: Understand how you can recover your vault even without the Keeper app or any service from the company
inheritence.Makessureyousignersareaccessible: Make sure you signers are accessible. Change them if that is not the case
inheritence.inheritanceSupportSubTitle: Keeper provides you with the tips and tools you need to include the vault in your estate planning
inheritence.consultYourEstate: Contact your estate planning attorney and advisors to ensure the documents provided here are suitable for your needs and are as per your jurisdiction
inheritence.learnMoreSubTitle: Plan your bitcoin Inheritance using the tools and templates offered here. These tools are meant to act as guardrails. Protecting your interests while still allowing you to customize an inheritance plan that works best for you and your heir.
inheritence.learnMoreDescription: Use the templates to speak with your estate planner, friends and family to set up your inheritance. Optionally, use the inheritance key as an extra security measure to protect the vault you wish to bequeath to your heir.

wallet.changePathOfDefaultWalletSubTitle: Derivation path changes should only be done by advanced users.
wallet.changePathOfDefaultWalletPara01: Changing the derivation path will mean that you will be using a completely new wallet. All the addresses and transactions will be reset to the new configuration
wallet.changePathOfDefaultWalletPara02: If you have given out addresses from this wallet before changing the dervation, they will not appear once the change takes effect.
wallet.walletBalanceMsg: Wallet has balance: changes not allowed
wallet.transactionBroadcasted: The transaction has been broadcasted successfully.
wallet.sendTransSuccessMsg: Check transaction details for more information
wallet.transactionPrioritySubTitle: Decide how fast you want to send sats
wallet.highFeeAlertSubTitle: Network fee is larger than the amount you are sending
wallet.watchOnlyDesc: You can keep an eye on an external wallet using this option.Note that you would be able to see various transactions and wallet balance but not send/receive sats.
wallet.walletConfigurationFileDesc: Have a specific multisig wallet that you’d like to recover? Have a specific multisig wallet that you’d like to recover? Use this option to recreate an existing multisig wallet. Note that if your Output Descriptor File ( aka the BSMS file) are from another Keeper app, only the specific vault that it belongs to, would be recreaeted. Not the whole app with all of its wallets.
wallet.addCoSignerDescTwo: With all 3 keys added, create the collaborative wallet.
wallet.addCoSignerDesc:
To add the other 2 keys: 
Setup Keeper on 2 different phones. These could be the phones of people with whom you wish to create the collaborative wallet. 
 
In each phone, please go to: Manage Keys > Mobile Key > Settings > Key Details. You will be shown a QR. Please scan the QRs from both phones to add each key.
wallet.useSignersVaultRegistrationDesc: Wish to import a multisig that is registered with a hardware signer. You can use this option for the purpose. Note that this option would help you 1 multisig wallet at a time.
wallet.tapRootPrivacyDesc: Taproot makes single-key and multi-key transactions indistinguishable on the bitcoin blockchain.
wallet.tapRootEfficiencyDesc: Taproot makes single-key and multi-key transactions indistinguishable on the bitcoin blockchain.
wallet.tapRootScalableDesc: Taproot introduces Merkleized Abstract Syntax Trees (MAST), allowing the creation of more complex spending conditions.
wallet.tapRootSecurityDesc: The switch to Schnorr signatures not only improves privacy and efficiency but also contributes to better security.
wallet.hideWalletModalDesc: You can unhide this wallet anytime from App Settings >Manage Wallets > Unhide
wallet.walletFundsTitle: You have funds in your wallet
wallet.walletFundsSubtitle: You have sats in your wallet. Are you sure you want to hide it?
wallet.hideWalletDesc: Hidden wallets can be managed from manage wallets
wallet.ScanQRData: Please scan until all the QR data has been retrieved
wallet.CoSignerExists: This co-signer has already been added
wallet.SelfKeyError: You cannot use more than one of your own Mobile Keys!
wallet.CollaborativeWalletCreated: A 2 of 3 collaborative wallet will be created
wallet.CollaborativeWalletSubtitle: A collaborative with three App Keys on three separate devices.
wallet.CollaborativeWalletDesc: You should ensure you have a copy of the wallet configuration file for this vault
wallet.highCustom: Network fee is more than 10% of the amount being sent. Consider using custom fee option.
wallet.highWait: Network fee is 10% higher than usual. If not urgent, consider waiting for the fee to go down.
wallet.highUsual: Network fee is within usual range or lower. A good time to broadcast transactions.
wallet.lowFee: Network fee is less than 10% of the amount being sent.
wallet.discardTnxSubTitle: This transaction's UTXO has already been used.
wallet.discardTnxDesc: Please discard this transaction and initiate a new one

vault.VaultDesc: A signer is an an air gapped device which helps you keep your vault safe
vault.Setupinheritancetoyoursats: Set up inheritance to your sats
vault.VaultCreationDesc: Your Basic vault has been successfully setup You can start receiving bitcoin in it
vault.VaultInfo: A signer can be a hardware wallet or a signer or an app. Most popular ones are listed above. Want support for more?
vault.toActiveVault: Add signer to activate your vault
vault.manageInheritance: Manage Inheritance key or view documents
vault.additionalOptionForSignDevice: There are also some additional options if you do not have hardware signers
vault.sendVaultSignDevices: For sending out of the vault you will need the signers. This means no one can steal your bitcoin in the vault unless they also have the signers
vault.addEmailNoteSubtitle: You can delete or change this information from Inheritance Key settings
vault.IKSconfMissToast: Something went wrong, IKS configuration missing
vault.IKSconfMissVaultToast: Something went wrong, IKS configuration missing for vault
vault.addEmailDetails: Additionally you can provide an email which will be used to notify you when someone tries to access the Inheritance Key
vault.addEmailVaultDetail: Optionally provide email and/ or phone for key usage alerts.
vault.walletSetupDetails: This kind of wallet setup can be used for business partnerships, family funds, or any scenario where joint control of funds is necessary.
vault.keeperSupportSigningDevice: Keeper supports all the popular bitcoin signers (Hardware Wallets) that a user can select
vault.collaborativeWalletMultipleUsers: Collaborative wallet is designed to enable multiple users to have control over a single wallet, adding a layer of security and efficiency in fund management.
vault.signingOldVault: Old Vaults with the previous signer configuration will be in the archived list of Vaults
vault.cvvSigningServerInfo: If you lose your authenticator app, use the other signers to reset the signer
vault.backingUpMnemonicSubtitle: You are about to write down a few words that would backup your mnemonic. Please ensure to do it privately.
vault.confirmOTPTitle: Confirm OTP for One Time Backup
vault.pendingHealthCheckSubtitle: You are trying to receive funds in a vault for which the health check of keys is pending.
vault.pendingHealthCheckDec: You can perform Health Check for these keys from their settings.
vault.VaultCreatedModalDesc: You should ensure you have a copy of the wallet configuration file for this vault
vault.Vault3_5CreatedModalDesc1: For sending bitcoin out of the vault you will need the signers
vault.Vault3_5CreatedModalDesc2: This means no one can steal your sats from the vault unless they also have access to your signers
vault.Vault3_5CreatedModalDesc3: Additionally, Get notified of Key activation and have option to decline use
vault.vaultLearnMoreSubtitle: Create multi-key vaults of various configurations. Subscribe to unlock advanced features.
vault.canaryLearnMoreSubtitle: Each key used in a multi-key wallet can also be used as a single-key wallet itself. Keeping funds in these wallets act as Canary.
vault.canaryLearnMoreDesc: If someone gets access to one of the keys and finds funds in the single-key wallet they may try to withdraw those funds. This will be detected by the app and the user will be advised to change that key from any multi-key setup.
vault.hideVaultModalDesc: You can unhide this vault anytime from App Settings >Manage Wallets > Unhide
vault.vaultConfigurationFileDesc: Vault configuration that needs to be stored privately
vault.vaultHideDesc: Hidden vaults can be managed from manage wallets
vault.vaultSchemeDesc: Update your vault configuration and transfer funds
vault.vaultEditSubtitle: This will reflect on the home screen
vault.vaultFundsTitle: You have funds in your vault
vault.vaultFundsSubtitle: You have sats in your vault. Are you sure you want to hide it?
vault.archivedVaultsNote: These are previous versions of this vault for reference or withdrawn if funds remaining.
vault.archivedVaultEmptySubtitle: All archived vaults for this vault would be available here.
vault.verifyAddDesc: Please download the Bitcoin Keeper desktop app from our website to connect
vault.transactionToastMessage: If the transaction isn’t visible, wait a moment and refresh.

seed.InvalidSeeds: Oops! The seed you've entered is incorrect.
seed.InvalidSeedsSubtitle: Make sure to avoid spelling mistakes and enter the words in the correct sequence.
seed.InvalidSeedsDesc: Please use the seedwords privately. Your bitcoin could be stolen if people gain access to your seedwords.
seed.seedDescription: Make sure to use the Wallet Recovery Phrase (seed words) in private
seed.SeedDesc: Make sure you keep it safe
seed.desc: Use these to create any other wallet and that wallet will be linked to Keeper (will show along with other wallets)
seed.enterRecoveryPhraseNote: Make sure to use the 12-word recovery phrase in private
seed.showXPubNoteSubText: Losing your Wallet Seed Words may result in permanent loss of funds. Store them carefully.
seed.SeedErrorToast: Please fill in all seed word fields
seed.appRecoveredSuccessfulSubTitle: All your wallets and data about your vault has been recovered
seed.appRecoveredSuccessfulDesc: The vault keys always stay within the signing devices and therefore do not have to be recovered
seed.mobileKeySeedNoteSubTitle: The QR below comprises of your 12-word Mobile Key
seed.mobileKeySeedNote: Losing your Mobile Key may compromise a hot wallet and potential vaults. Store securely and never share.
seed.storeSecurely: Write down these words and store them securely.

settings.torViaOrbotSubTitle: Use the Orbot app. Greater control, quicker connection and advanced options
settings.inAppTorSubTitle: Use direct Tor. No need to download a separate app. May be slow and unreliable
settings.torSettingsNoteSubTitle: Some WiFi networks use settings that do not let your device connect to Tor. If you get constant errors, try changing to mobile network or check your network settings
settings.orbotConnectionSubTitle: To connect to Tor via Orbot, you need to have the Orbot app installed on your device.
settings.networkSettingSubTitle: Node and Tor in Network Setting

settings.satsModeSubTitle: Enable to see balance in sats

settings.currencyErrorSubTitle: This currency currently does not exist.
settings.EnterPasscodeSubtitle: Confirm passcode to show all hidden keys
settings.ManageWalletsEmptySubtitle: Avoid clutter on the homescreen and keep wallets away from prying eyes.
settings.DeleteWalletModalTitle: You have funds in your wallet
settings.DeleteWalletModalSubTitle: You have sats in your wallet. Are you sure you want to delete it?
settings.DeleteVaultModalSubTitle: You are about to delete a vault with sats in it. Please ensure that you have backed-up your keys and vault descriptor to retrieve the vault later.
settings.DeleteWalletModalDesc: To delete this wallet, please transfer your funds to another wallet or vault first.
settings.DeleteVaultModalDesc: This action is irreversible without the keys and descriptor backed-up. Proceed to delete vault?
settings.RKHealthCheckDesc: Please Back up your Recovery Key in order to change your current Passcode
settings.RKBackupSubTitle: Carefully write down the 12-word Recovery Key in a private place and ensure its security
settings.passcodeHCModalTitle: Recovery Key Health Check During Passcode Reset
settings.passcodeHCModalSubTitle: We request you to enter a few seed words during passcode reset to verify your identity and ownership of the wallet.
settings.passcodeHCModalDesc: This ensures that even if a passcode is forgotten, access to the wallet remains secure by confirming the Recovery Key, a critical piece of information that only the legitimate wallet owner should have.
settings.torDescription: This will redirect you to the Orbot app and you can configure the connection from there.

onboarding.slide01Paragraph: Create single or multi-key wallets using popular signing devices. Perform air-gapped signing. Do regular health checks for keys.
onboarding.slide02Title:
Security should not
come at the cost of
onboarding.slide02Paragraph: No account creation is needed. Run your own node. Connect via Tor. Manage UTXOs and whirlpool sats.
onboarding.slide03Title:
Secure bitcoin for you and
your loved ones, anywhere
onboarding.slide03Paragraph: Use all the Keeper features, including inheritance, no matter which country you are located in as long as the app is available in your country.
onboarding.slide04Title:
All that you will need for
securing your bitcoin
onboarding.slide04Paragraph: BIP 85 hot wallets, auto-transfer to vault, buy bitcoin directly in to your cold storage, and much more
onboarding.slide05Title:
Works just with the mobile app,
no computer needed
onboarding.slide05Paragraph: More security with NFC and QR code compatibility. Connect directly to the hardware signers, without any intermediate step
onboarding.slide06Title:
Affordable plans
and a great offer
onboarding.slide06Paragraph: And now for a limited time, all tiers for the Keeper are free for the first 6 months. Download Keeper and setup your vault now.
onboarding.slide07Paragraph: You can remix your sats for free for enhanced privacy before storing them in your vault
onboarding.slide08Title:
Upgrade to Diamond Hands for
 generational hodling
onboarding.slide08Paragraph: Plan your inheritance. Get access to Assisted Keys. Avail priority support.

signer.deleteVaultInstruction: Please delete the vault to perform this operation.
signer.thisStepTakesTime: This step will take a few seconds.
signer.forgot2FANote: If you have lost your 2FA app, it is recommended that you remove SS and add a different key or SS again
signer.remoteKeyReceiveNote: Please accept the key before the timer expires. If not accepted in time, you will have to request the key again.
signer.keyExpireMessage: You had received a Key from your contact. Unfortunately, the timer has run out.
signer.signingRequestExpireMessage: You had received a signing request. The timer has run out.
signer.manageKeysModalSubtitle: All your keys would be visible in this section.
signer.manageKeysModalDesc: You can ensure their accessibility via Health Checks, fund Canary Wallets, view fingerprints and even change signer type, all from this central location for keys.
signer.runUnlockCard: Run the unlock card process if it's rate-limited
signer.linkExternalWallet: Use to link external wallet to keeper
signer.mobileKeySeedOptionSubtitle: Use to backup/ export mobile key

inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletDescp1: Each key used in a multi-key wallet can also be used as a single-key wallet itself. Keeping funds in these wallets act as Canary.
inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletDescp2: If someone gets access to one of the keys and finds funds in the single-key wallet they may try to withdraw those funds. This will be detected by the app and the user will be advised to change that key from any multi-key setup.
inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletDescp3: These wallets can be accessed and funded from the Settings of any key
inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletCtaDescp: View keys' details or add new
inheritancePlanning.signingServerDescp: Use 2FA code to sign a transaction
inheritancePlanning.signingServerParagraph2: Please setup the 2FA on a different phone. You would only require the 2FA for a specified amount that would be within a range set by you. Below the minimum amount the 2FA won’t be needed, while you’ll be prompted to use a different key beyond the maximum amount.
inheritancePlanning.signingServerParagraph1: Allows an automated script to sign the transaction when correct 2FA code is provided. The Key allows you to easily sign a transaction via a simple 2FA code instead of using a hardware signer.
inheritancePlanning.signingServerNotes: Signing Server is a hot key. Please decide the amount you’d like to use Signing Server for, carefully.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyDescp: To be considered while inheritance planning
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyParagraph2: When a request is made to use this key for signing or recovery, there is a 30 day delay. This gives time to the user to decline the request if they don’t identify it. The request alerts are sent on the app and can also be sent on email or via sms.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyParagraph1: Inheritance Key is an additional key available to increase the security of the vault without having to buy a hardware signer. It is available to all Diamond Hands subscribers.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyCtaNotes: Please provide detailed explanations and support to your heir via the inheritance document templates
inheritancePlanning.thoroughParagraph1: Carefully review all transaction details, particularly the recipient’s address, within your multi-key setup. This careful attention is essential to avoid errors and secure your transactions, ensuring the safety of your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.thoroughParagraph2: It is recommended to use atleast one hardware device with a screen. This allows to register your multi-key quorum on the device and thoroughly check transactions.
inheritancePlanning.preliminaryParagraph1: Before making significant transfers, conduct a small test transaction. This step verifies the transaction’s accuracy and confirms the smooth functioning of your multi-key setup, adding a protective layer to your bitcoin transactions.
inheritancePlanning.preliminaryParagraph2: This will not just ensure that the system is working as intended but will also be a practice for you before you actually need it.
inheritancePlanning.secureCoordinationParagraph1: Use encrypted communication for coordinating transaction approvals with other key holders. This ensures everyone is on the same page regarding the transaction details, protecting the integrity of your bitcoin transactions.
inheritancePlanning.secureCoordinationParagraph2: Please screen your key holders for trustworthiness in terms of handling the key and having your best interest in mind.
inheritancePlanning.crossDeviceParagraph1: To further enhance security, verify transaction details on multiple devices involved in your multi-key setup. This approach can help identify any discrepancies or fraudulent attempts, securing your bitcoin transactions effectively.
inheritancePlanning.crossDeviceParagraph2: You are encouraged to recreate the multi-key setup on another co-ordinator app to have complete independence from Keeper.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyParagraph1: Each of the vault (multi-key wallet) has configuration details that are needed during recovery.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyParagraph2: Your app’s meta data along with all the configuration files are stored on the Keeper cloud server encrypted with the Recovery Key.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyParagraph3: Simply backing up or noting down the Master Recovery Key gives you access to all this data which is updated automatically.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyNote: Master Recovery Key also gives access to the app’s hot keys. Please secure the key properly.
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudParagph1: Wallet configuration files for vaults can alternatively be stored on a personal cloud. This ensures that you or your heir have access to them independent of the Keeper app.
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudParagph2: These files are also encrypted with the Master Recovery Key which needs to be backed up properly.
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudNotes: This action needs to be performed regularly as configuration details change
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudDescp: Use your iCloud or Google Drive
inheritancePlanning.walletConfigFilesNote: When there is a new vault or change in a vault the configuration file needs to be downloaded again.
inheritancePlanning.walletConfigFilesParagraph1: For multi-key wallets or vaults, it is important to have the configuration files along with the minimum number of keys needed.
inheritancePlanning.walletConfigFilesParagraph2: The wallet configuration file, also known as Output Descriptor or the BSMS file is an important item for vault recovery. Please store it carefully.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryComprehensiveP2: These backups should be stored in secure, discrete locations to ensure redundancy and resilience against loss or environmental damage.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryComprehensiveP1: Create durable backups of all critical components, like seed phrases and multi-key configurations, on both physical (metal tools for engraving) and digital (encrypted files) mediums.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryConductP2: Try all the methods for backup and recovery suggested by Keeper and see what suits you. Ensure you can perform this step during an emergency.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryConductP1: As a test, use the backup information to recover your multi-key setup periodically. The test ensures your backup’s reliability for restoring access to your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecovertPractice: Practice Recovery by Deletion and Restoration
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryP2: This process tests the effectiveness of your backup strategy, ensuring that you can confidently rely on it for recovering access to your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryP1: After backing up your app and multi-key configuration, intentionally delete the setup from your primary device. Then, attempt to recover it on a fresh app installation or another coordinator app using your backup.
inheritancePlanning.backupKeepsBackupP2: Maintaining up-to-date backups is essential for seamless access to your bitcoin, providing security and peace of mind.
inheritancePlanning.backupKeepsBackupP1: Whenever changes are made to your multi-key setup, promptly update your backups and any associated documentation to reflect these adjustments. This includes revising recovery instructions and ensuring all backup mediums are current.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseDescp: Note down any set of seed words
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsDescp: Template to share details of contacts
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysDescp: Template to share useful key details
inheritancePlanning.recoveryInstructionsP1: Recovery Instructions is a document containing information and steps to be used by the heir to recover the funds.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryInstructionsP2: The document contains no sensitive information. It can be kept along with all the keys or separately.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryInstructionsNotes: Test the recovery using the instructions provided to ensure everything is in place.
inheritancePlanning.letterOfAttorneyP1: This pre-filled letter uses key fingerprints that uniquely identify the keys used in the app without revealing any other information about the setup.
inheritancePlanning.letterOfAttorneyP2: The information contained here could be used by the attorney or estate planner to create the will or other estate planning documents.
inheritancePlanning.letterOfAttorneyNotes: The key fingerprint information here does not leak any details about your balance.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceTipsDescp: How to secure keys for the heir
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseDescpMain: Note down any set of seed words
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseP1: This is a simple template that can be printed out on a small piece of paper (ideally acid-free).
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseP2: Seed Words of any of your keys can be written down on them with an archival type pen and the sheet laminated at home.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseNotes: Please ensure to never reveal the filled up document to anyone other than your intended heir.
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsTemplateDescp: Details of people to assist your heir
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsP1: A simple template to note down a list of trusted contacts and their details. This can then be stored along with the keys or separately.
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsRef: Refer to Safeguarding Tips for more details
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsNotes: Please ensure that these individuals would be willing to help your heir selflessly.
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsCtaDescp: Contact details to assist your heir
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysMainDescp: Particulars about each signer in the vault
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysMainP1: This template provides a format to store the details of the signers or keys. These details are sensitive in nature. Thus the use of this document should be considered carefully.
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysCtaNotes: Please ensure to keep this document up to date to avoid hassles for the heir.
inheritancePlanning.documentMultiKeyP2: Please make sure that your heir has access to the wallet configuration file and knows how to recover a vault using it.
inheritancePlanning.documentMultiKeyP1: Clearly outline your multi-key setup in estate planning documents, specifying who inherits your bitcoin. This ensures heirs have both legal rights and practical guidance for accessing their inheritance, bridging any knowledge gaps.
inheritancePlanning.educateHireTitle: Educate Heirs on Bitcoin and Multi-Key Security
inheritancePlanning.educateHireP2: Ask your heir to test the multi-key setups they create. This would act as good practice for them to inherit your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.educateHireP1: Proactively teach heirs about the importance of bitcoin security, focusing on multi-key practices. Well-informed heirs are better equipped to manage and secure their bitcoin effectively.
inheritancePlanning.selectKnowledgeableP2: Please ensure that the trustees are, trustable. Else you run the risk of them colluding to keep your bitcoin for themselves.
inheritancePlanning.selectKnowledgeableP1: Choose executors or trustees with a thorough understanding of bitcoin and multi-key systems. Their expertise will be crucial in managing and transferring your bitcoin according to your wishes, ensuring a smooth inheritance process.
inheritancePlanning.regularUpdatesTitle: Regularly Update Estate Plans and Instructions
inheritancePlanning.regularUpdatesP2: Please keep an eye out for firmware and other updates from device manufacturers. Sometimes buttons get moved around or processes change that would need to be updated in your instructions.
inheritancePlanning.regularUpdatesP1: Keep your estate planning documents and instructions regarding your multi-key setup, up-to-date. Changes in your setup or personal circumstances should be promptly reflected to avoid future complications for your heirs.

cloudBackup.cloudBackupSubtitle: Keeper's Cloud Backup feature allows you to securely store your multikey configuration files and metadata on your preferred cloud service. This ensures that even if your device is lost or damaged, your multikey setup and related data can be easily recovered. The file itself is protected by a password setup by you within the app. This enhances the security of your BSMS file folder on your cloud.
cloudBackup.cloudBackupModalSubitle: Easily access your vault configuration files from anywhere on any bitcoin wallet.
cloudBackup.cloudBackupModalDesc: Once initiated, the backups are updated automatically. Rest assured of having the latest vault configurations.

notification.vaultTransferSubTitle: Amount of sats in your wallet ($wallet) have crossed the auto-transfer threshold. Ready to transfer sats to vault.
notification.vaultTransferBody: You can always change the transfer threshold from Wallet Settings.
